title: Alacritty 0.13.2 (and 1cc08eb) leaks file descriptors
body:
First of all, thank you for maintaining and developing Alacritty! I've encountered an issue where Alacritty leaks a number of file descriptors on my system (using `% alacritty`):
```
% ls -la /proc/self/fd
lrwx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  0 -> /dev/pts/4
lrwx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  1 -> /dev/pts/4
lrwx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  2 -> /dev/pts/4
lr-x------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  15 -> pipe:[150277]
l-wx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  16 -> pipe:[150277]
lr-x------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  19 -> pipe:[150280]
l-wx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  20 -> pipe:[150280]
```

Every new alacritty subprocess inherits more file descriptors (using `% alacritty -e alacritty`):
```
% ls -la /proc/self/fd
lrwx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  0 -> /dev/pts/5
lrwx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  1 -> /dev/pts/5
lrwx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  2 -> /dev/pts/5
lr-x------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  15 -> pipe:[152262]
l-wx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  16 -> pipe:[152262]
lr-x------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  17 -> pipe:[167016]
l-wx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  18 -> pipe:[167016]
lr-x------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  19 -> pipe:[152265]
l-wx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  20 -> pipe:[152265]
lr-x------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  23 -> pipe:[167019]
l-wx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:43  24 -> pipe:[167019]
```
This also applies to the `SpawnNewInstance` action.

The expected behavior is that subprocesses do not inherit any additional file descriptors (tested using a different terminal emulator `% st`):
```
% ls -la /proc/self/fd
lrwx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:44  0 -> /dev/pts/4
lrwx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:44  1 -> /dev/pts/4
lrwx------ 64 user 16 Oct 21:44  2 -> /dev/pts/4
```

I'm sure this is reproducible not just on my system, but I'd be happy to provide more information if needed.

### System

OS: Linux
Version: `alacritty 0.13.2` (also occurs with commit `1cc08eb`)
Linux/BSD: X11, picom and bspwm
